Pastix.pl

The main run launching script.  It allows to compile executables and runs them.  It is also possible to generate Latex output.

Usage

Pastix.pl [ -h ] [ -A | -cfe ] -h Affiche cette aide -H Affiche les options du scripts -A Equivalent a -cfe -c Compile les différentes versions -f Crée les répertoires et les fichiers des différents cas -e Exécute l’ensemble des cas -o Spécifie le fichier de sortie de la liste de soumission -b Soumet en ‘besteffort’ pour OAR -g Génère un tableau de résultat en latex -p Permet de spécifier le reseau pour Madeleine -m Mail errors -d Fill/Check database -v Stoppe la compilation après chaque compilation avec erreur -V Passe IPARM_VERBOSE à 2 -s x IO Strategy (1 : Load / 2 : Save / 3 : Save on first, Load on next one)

Authors

Mathieu Favergefav.nosp@m.erge@labr.nosp@m.i.fr
Xavier Lacostelac.nosp@m.oste@labr.nosp@m.i.fr
Summary
Pastix.plThe main run launching script.
Variables
%opts
besteffortindicate if we want to use besteffort
multiprocbynodeindicate if we have to indicate the number of task by node
verbosemodeindicate if we want to interact with the script, stopping for errors and warning, etc.
mailingmodeindicate if we want to send the result of the rune by mail
databasemodeindicate if we want to fill/check the database
mailtxtthe text of the sended mail
comp_totthe number of compilation to perform
comp_errthe number of compilation which failed
exec_totthe number of execution to perform
exec_errthe number of execution which failed
exec_warthe number of execution which we have to care about
lstmetrThe list of the metrique that we want in output
sendmailThe sendmail command
Functions
UsagePrints usage.
containReturns 1 if a string appear in an array of string, 0 otherwise.
minReturns the minimum value between two values.
CompilationCompilate the different executables
Matrice_GetParamModifie les paramètres de facto et de symmétrie en fonction de la matrice et initialise les autres parametres
CreateDirAndFilesCreate the result tree
ExecuteJobsRuns the jobs
GenLatexGenerate Latex output

sub Usage #()

Prints usage.

contain

sub contain #($string,
@array)

Returns 1 if a string appear in an array of string, 0 otherwise.

Parameters

stringThe string searched for.
arrayThe array in which we search.

min

sub min #($a,
$b)

Returns the minimum value between two values.

Parameters

aFirst value to compare
bSecond value to compare
